results.title: Woman, 29, Enrolled in High School and Pretended to Be a Teenager
results.abstract: The woman attended classes in New Brunswick for four days before her ruse was discovered, officials said.

media.caption: Hyejeong Shin, 29, was arrested on Tuesday and charged with providing documents that falsified her age to officials at New Brunswick Public Schools.

results.byline: By Christopher Flavelle and Mira Rojanasakul
results.title: As the Colorado River Shrinks, Washington Prepares to Spread the Pain
results.abstract: The seven states that rely on the river for water are not expected to reach a deal on cuts. It appears the Biden administration will have to impose reductions.

media.caption: The shore of Lake Powell in Page, Ariz. Along with Lake Mead, it provides water and electricity for Arizona, Nevada and Southern California.

results.title: Here is a timeline of events in the death of Tyre Nichols.
results.abstract: Mr. Nichols was pulled over by the Memphis police on the evening of Jan. 7 and died three days later. Five officers were charged with murder on Thursday.

results.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Jonathan Weisman
results.title: Republicans Re-elect Head of the R.N.C. After a Heated Challenge
results.abstract: Ronna McDaniel won a fourth two-year term to lead the Republican National Committee, fending off a fierce challenge after the party’s poor midterm showing.

media.caption: Ronna McDaniel, the chair of the Republican National Committee, promised to be the agent of change that Republican activists wanted and to keep the committee neutral in the coming presidential primary contest.

results.title: Paul La Farge, Inventive Novelist, Is Dead at 52
results.abstract: He played with history and narrative techniques whether writing about 19th-century France or H.P. Lovecraft.

media.caption: The author Paul La Farge in an undated photo. His novels and short stories defied easy categorization, but they were all characterized by a sort of writer’s derring-do.

results.title: Lance Kerwin, ‘James at 15’ and ‘Salem’s Lot’ Star, Dies at 62
results.abstract: “James,” which followed the adventures of a sandy-haired teenager who moves with his family to Boston from Oregon, made him a teenage idol.

media.caption: Lance Kerwin in 1978, when he was the star of the NBC drama “James at 15.”

results.title: Videos show Memphis police kicking and beating Tyre Nichols as he begs them to stop.
results.abstract: Throughout the beating, which lasts about three minutes, Mr. Nichols does not appear to ever strike back. Several times, he moves his hands to cover his face, seeming to cower from the officers’ blows.

results.title: From Sacramento to Memphis, Tyre Nichols Cut His Own Path
results.abstract: Social media posts show that Mr. Nichols harbored a mistrust of prevailing government and economic systems, yet, a friend says, he also considered trying to change policing from the inside.

results.title: An R.N.C. Remade by Trump Backs Away From His 2024 Campaign
results.abstract: Interviews with more than a third of the Republican National Committee’s members point to a desire for an alternative presidential nominee to emerge from a competitive primary.
